newsitem.title: LITHUANIA: INTERVIEW-LITHUANIA SEES '97 GDP GROWTH AT 5 PCT.
newsitem.headline: INTERVIEW-LITHUANIA SEES '97 GDP GROWTH AT 5 PCT.

text.p: Lithuanian Prime Minister Gediminas Vagnorius said that he expects the country's gross domestic product (GDP) to expand by five percent in 1997.
"GDP will grow by at least five percent this year," Vagnorius told Reuters in an interview.
"In 1998, we expect growth of around seven to eight percent," he said.
Lithuania's economy began to grow again in 1994 after a sharp slump sparked by the collapse of the country's trading ties with the former Soviet Union.
Preliminary data suggests that GDP grew by four percent in 1996.
Vagnorius also said that he expects inflation to be around 12 percent this year and less than ten percent in 1998 after reaching 13.1 percent in 1996.
